oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Slit-type Breakwater; Box-type Wave Absorber
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Nagai, Shoshichiro
Kakuno, Shohachi
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: breakwater
slit breakwater
wave absorber
box type wave absorber
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A box-type wave absorber, which is composed of a perforated vertical front-wall and a perforated, horizontal bottom-wall, has been proved by a number of experiments to show lower coefficients of reflection and more distinguished reduction of wave pressures than the perforated vertical- wall breakwater. A breakwater of composite-type, which is 1500 m long and to be built at a water depth of 10 to 11 m below the Datum Line in the Port of Osaka, is being designed to set this new type of wave absorber in the concrete caissons of the vertical-walls which is named "a slit-type breakwater". The typical cross-section of the breakwater and the advantages of the slit-type breakwater are presented herein.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 15 (1976): Proceedings of 15th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Honolulu, Hawaii, 1976.; 154
